{"step_by_step_thinking": "Zika fever is a mosquito-borne viral disease caused by the Zika virus. The symptoms of Zika fever include fever, rash, joint pain, and conjunctivitis. Guillain-Barre syndrome is a rare neurological disorder that your body's immune system attacks your nerves, and it has been associated with Zika virus. Petechial rash, which is a rash that appears as small, pinpoint, round spots that appear on the skin as a result of bleeding, is not a common symptom of Zika fever. Fever with arthralgia, which is joint pain, is a common symptom of Zika fever.", "answer_choice": "B. Petechial rash"}
